newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded gasoline basis weakens.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded gasoline basis weakens.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent spot unleaded gasoline and diesel fuel differentials weakened across the board in thin trade on Thursday, traders said.
Chicago basis retained some strength from an outage that trimmed production at Clark Refining and Marketing Co's 80,515 barrel per day Blue Island, Ill., refinery.
Traders said an alkylation unit and fluid catalytic cracker were expected to come back on line by the weekend after being idled earlier in the week.
Group Three prompt low sulphur diesel differentials were talked 4.25/4.0 cents a gallon under the print, with later deliveries 5.0/4.75 cents a gallon under, traders said.
Chicago first-cycle low sulphur diesel eased to bids 5.0 cents a gallon under the print, with later deliveries 5.75 cents under.
High sulphur diesel was talked 5.75 cents a gallon under the print in Group Three and 6.25 cents a gallon under in Chicago.
Prompt unleaded was bid 2.25 cents a gallon under the print in Group Three and 0.50 cent under in Chicago, with later deliveries talked 1.0/1.50 cent weaker in both markets.
